concept.title: HTTP Client
concept.shortdesc: The HTTP Client origin reads data from an HTTP resource URL.

conbody.p: HTTP Client originovervieworiginsHTTP ClientWhen you configure HTTP Client, you specify the resource URL, optional headers, and other read properties.

The origin provides several different authentication types to access data. You can enter credentials in the origin or you can secure the credentials in runtime resource files and reference the files in the origin.
You can optionally use a truststore and keystore, and proxy.
